title: 112_hr3234
content: The "Unemployed Worker Assistance Act of 2011" allows penalty-free withdrawals for unemployed individuals who have exhausted their unemployment compensation rights. The "Unemployed Worker Assistance Act of 2011" permits penalty-free distributions to individuals who have used up their unemployment benefits under federal or state laws after leaving their job. The "Unemployed Worker Assistance Act of 2011" allows penalty-free distributions to individuals who have exhausted their unemployment benefits before returning to work or starting a new job. Qualified distributions can be repaid within a 5-year period to an eligible retirement plan. The "Unemployed Worker Assistance Act of 2011" permits penalty-free distributions to individuals who have used up their unemployment benefits before rejoining the workforce. Repayments of qualified distributions from eligible retirement plans other than IRAs are treated differently for tax purposes. If a taxpayer contributes to an individual retirement plan, they are treated as having received a qualified distribution and transferred the amount to an eligible retirement plan within 60 days. Repayments for distributions from IRAs are treated differently for tax purposes. If a contribution is made to an individual retirement plan, it is treated as a qualified distribution and transferred to an eligible retirement plan within 60 days. Special rules apply to these transactions. A qualified distribution is treated as meeting plan distribution requirements and is exempt from trustee to trustee transfer and withholding rules for certain sections. A qualified distribution meeting the requirements of clause (i) is not considered an eligible rollover distribution. The term 'qualified distribution' is defined as such, and 'eligible retirement plan' has the meaning given by section 402(c)(8)(B). Rules similar to reemployment and self-employment apply. Rules similar to clauses (ii) and (iii) of subparagraph (D) apply for this subparagraph. The amendment applies to distributions made after the enactment date of this Act.
